name: Leafs Dynasty Stats & Trends Engine
description: Lightweight stats and trends engine for Leafs Dynasty AI in NHL 25. Provides a consistent way to talk about recent form, PP/PK trends, streaks, and standings without inventing fake numbers.

covers: Team record and basic standings context
does_not_cover: Precise in-game boxscore-style statlines without user input
Full season sim stats for other teams unless user provides them

pp_band.hot: PP is clearly clicking, scoring regularly and feeling dangerous.
pp_band.average: PP is functional but not dominant.
pp_band.cold: PP is struggling to create chances or finish.

pk_band.hot: PK is shutting teams down and limiting clean entries.
pk_band.average: PK is acceptable but giving up some looks.
pk_band.cold: PK is leaking chances or goals too often.

notes: If exact record or stats are unknown, Dynasty GPT should ask you for a simple summary (e.g., 'We’re 18-10-2 and PP feels cold').
If you do not provide numbers, the engine should speak in soft trend language only ('PP has felt better lately', 'PK has been leaky').

last_5.label: Last 5 games
last_5.description: Fast-moving form; good for momentum and confidence language.

last_10.label: Last 10 games
last_10.description: More stable view of performance trends.

month_to_date.label: Month to date
month_to_date.description: Useful if you’re looking at a calendar view or talking about a tough month.

form_language_rules: If wins > losses in the last 5, describe as 'good form' or 'positive trend'.
If losses > wins in the last 5, describe as 'slump', 'skid', or 'rough patch'.
If goal differential is positive and PP/PK bands are 'hot' or 'average', describe as 'overall strong but with some issues'.
If goal differential is negative and PP or PK band is 'cold', describe as 'structural issues that need addressing'.
standings_language_rules: If points pace is strong, use language like 'firmly in the playoff mix' or 'pushing for home-ice'.
If record is close to .500, use 'on the bubble' or 'fighting to stay in the playoff race'.
If clearly below .500, use 'chasing the pack' or 'needing a run to get back in it'.
streak_language_rules: 3+ wins in a row → 'on a bit of a heater' or 'building a nice streak'.
3+ losses in a row → 'on a skid' or 'in a slide that needs to stop'.

summary_command.name: /team_summary
summary_command.description: Summarize overall record, trends, and PP/PK bands using user-supplied data or soft language if data is missing.

trend_command.name: /trend_report
trend_command.description: Explain how the team has been trending over the last 5–10 games and what that means for upcoming matchups.

output_expectations: Always be honest about whether numbers are user-supplied or trend-based language only.
Avoid inventing fake exact percentages or records.
Prefer: 'PP has felt cold in recent games' over 'PP is exactly 13.4%'.
Tie trends into upcoming opponents when possible (e.g., 'PP has been hot, which matters vs a weak PK like DET’s').

notes: This engine is intentionally light – it gives Dynasty GPT a safe way to talk about trends when you provide rough stats or feelings, without fabricating specific numbers.
Whenever you want deeper stats logic, you can extend this file in a future version (e.g., v1.1) without breaking Canon or tactics.
